item.title: Senior Integrated Border Management Expert with Customs/Movement of Goods Experience
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Returning of foreign fighters in Jordan: Assessment of the relevance and scope definition of a IcSP measure in integrated smart border management

Global objective The overall objective of the assignment is to contribute to improve integrated border management in Jordan to combat the threat of terrorism and different forms of transnational crime, with a particular focus on the potential return of foreign fighters in the months to come.

Specific objective The purpose of the assignment is to compile and analyse, together with the European Delegation to Jordan, the necessary information for the European Union and the Government of Jordan to assess the relevance and scope of a crisis prevention and response programme in the field of integrated smart border management based on the international and EU objectives on Integrated and Smart Border Management and taking into account current threats, in particular the potential return of foreign fighters.

Project duration: 90 days

Senior Integrated Border Management Expert with Customs/Movement of Goods Experience

Two experts are required for this project:

Minimum expertise required:

Both experts shall have the following basic expertise:

  • University degree in a subject relevant for the security and justice sectors (e.g. related to justice, rule of law, human rights, etc.);
  • Experience in either the identification, formulation, implementation, monitoring or evaluation of development/technical cooperation projects/programmes funded by international donors in border management;
  • Excellent command of both written and spoken English.

Integrated Border Management expert with Customs background focusing on movement of goods (maximum 35 working days, including 20 working days in Jordan)

  • At least 12 years of experience in IBM strategies and border related issues at different levels of responsibility and in different areas of expertise including border management and customs issues.

  • At least 5 years of demonstrated experience in development/technical cooperation projects/programmes in the field Border Management

  • Significant experience in either the identification, formulation, implementation, monitoring or evaluation of development/technical cooperation projects/programmes funded by international donors in border management

  • Relevant experience in counter terrorism and, where appropriate, countering violent extremism related issues.

Additional criteria for both experts

  • Experience in working on broader migration issues, justice and home affairs issues or crisis management and security issues in the Arab world will be considered an asset.
  • Proven experience in border management database and network security and system administration; within a government or international migration and border management structure would be an added advantage.
  • Experience working directly or as consultant for the European Union, an OECD-DAC development cooperation agency, a United Nations agency or an International Financial Institution in Jordan will be considered an asset.
  • Previous experience of working with the military will be considered an asset.

item.title: 4 Experts, Evaluation a mi-parcours NFD 'Une administration pour tous'
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation a mi-parcours NFD ‘Une administration pour tous’

  • une appréciation globale, en toute indépendance, des résultats de l’intervention de NFD en s’attachant plus particulièrement aux résultats du projet par rapport à ses objectifs;
  • les principaux enseignements de l'intervention et des recommandations afin d’améliorer les mesures en cours et les futures actions et choix stratégiques futurs, aussi en vue d’une possible demande d’avenant pour le projet.

Les principaux utilisateurs de cette évaluation seront la Délégation de l’Union européenne auprès de la République du Madagascar, le Gouvernement de Madagascar dont le PREA (Programme de Renforcement de l'Efficacité de l'Administration) en particulier, le contractant et l’équipe d’assistance technique du projet NFD. L’évaluation présentera également un intérêt pour les partenaires techniques et financiers et pour la société civile au sens large.

L'équipe d'évaluation sera composée au moins de 3 experts categorie I au II et 1 expert de categorie I (4 experts au total) comme contrôle de qualité possédant le profil et les qualifications suivants en tant qu’equipe:

Compétences communes:

  • une expérience solide et diversifiée dans le domaine d'expertise spécifique requis, notamment une expérience en matière d'évaluation de projets et des evaluation des reformes institutionnelles (pour au moins deux experts, dont le chef d'équipe);
  • une expérience de la région (le nombre d'années d'expérience peut être différent d'un expert à un autre, indépendamment de son statut dans l'équipe); la connaissance du Madagascar sera un plus, notamment pour le chef d’equipe
  • la maîtrise opérationnelle du français ainsi qu'une excellente capacité en matière de rédaction de rapports;
  • la maîtrise totale des principes et des méthodes de travail de la gestion du cycle de projet ainsi que des méthodes de l'aide communautaire;

Compétences particulières:

  • Au moins un expert proposé doit posséder à la fois une connaissance solide en Finance Publique et de l'analyse de la prise en compte de ces questions dans le processus de reforme
  • Au moins un expert proposé doit posséder à la fois une connaissance solide dans le secteur de gestion des Ressouces Humaines de l’Etat en particulier dans le processus de reforme
  • Au moins un expert proposé doit posséder une connaissance en matière de reformes du secteur de la Justice
  • Au moins un expert doit disposer d'une expérience pratique des techniques d’analyse de PEA (Political Economy Analysis)

La composition de l'équipe d'experts doit être équilibrée afin de permettre une couverture exhaustive des différents aspects de l'évaluation de projets (thematiques et méthodes et techniques d'évaluation) exposés dans les présents termes de référence, notamment des questions transversales.

item.title: Expert in Investment Promotion and Reforms & Financial Services to SMEs
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation of Programme to Support the Investment and the Business Environment in the SADC Region

Global objective

The global objective of the assignment is to provide expert assistance to the SADC Secretariat and the EU Delegation to Botswana and SADC in order to complete the formulation of a Programme on “Support to the Investment and the Business Environment in the SADC Region”, taking into account the assistance provided to by other International Cooperation Partners (ICPs). The Programme is foreseen to be funded by the 11th EDF under the Annual Action programme 2017.

Specific objectives

The specific objective is to finalise Action Fiche for this programme, to be financed from EDF 11 and to be presented to EU Headquarters within the Annual Action Plan (AAP) 2017. In this regard, the Formulation Mission will complete the programme design, in particular regarding the following aspects:

  • Revise the current Action Document and foreseen activities;
  • Advise on the most adequate implementation modality for each component;
  • Identify the most appropriate implementing partners for each of the components, citing reasons for the proposed implementation partners;
  • Finalise the full formulation of the programme in line with EU project Cycle Guidelines, and assist in the production of all formulation documents needed to be included in the Annual Action Programme (AAP) 2017 in line with the latest templates and in consultation with the SADC Secretariat and stakeholders, the EU Delegation and other ICPs;

Expert in Investment Promotion and Reforms & Financial Services to SMEs

  • Preferably Masters degree in Finance, Economics or equivalent or, in its absence, at least 3 years of professional experience in addition to the minimum professional experience required;
  • At least 6 years of professional experience on investment promotion and reforms to improve the business environment; • Fluency in English (written, spoken, understanding); • Expertise and experience in analytical and presentation skills. • Experience on financial services to Small, medium and micro-enterprises (credit lines, equity, guarantees, micro-credit); • Good understanding of EDF rules and procedures; • Experience on EU project formulation; • Experience in a Sub-Saharan African context. Specific experience in the SADC region will be an asset.
